title: Drawing, ""What is this bill? Give it to me to look at."", 1911–13
markings:
Recto: lower right on margin: Cooper Union Museum New York
[Lugt 457e]
signed: Lower left in charcoal: John Sloan - 11-
inscribed: In ink across top of sheet: "The Count's Millions - Gabooriau - Give it me to look at. B.2088
provenance: Given by Miss F. Elizabeth DeVoy
creditline: Gift of F. Elizabeth De Voy
description: A man in a frock coat and top hat stands at right. He is being questioned by a man wearing a white apron at left. A heavy-set woman wearing a kerchief stands behing a counter. The setting is a small dry-goods or grocery store of the last century.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, ""What is this bill? Give it to me to look at."", 1911–13.
1911–13. Charcoal, brush and gray wash. Gift of F. Elizabeth De Voy. 1957-58-21.
